section.title: Working with categories in the browsers and editors
section.para: Categories let you group items together to be able to keep an overview of your data and find things more easily. You can use categories in the Test Case Browser, in the Test Suite Browser, in the Central Test Data Editor and in the Object Mapping Editor (see the section on object mapping for information on categories in the Object Mapping Editor ()).

listitem.para:
In the browser or editor, select:
New-->Category from the context-sensitive menu.
Once you have a category, you can add items to it by drag and drop, and also by double-clicking to add new items (only in the browsers).
You can also nest categories in other categories.
You can do this either by dragging and dropping a category into another category, or by right-clicking in an already present category and choosing the option to create a new category.

section.title: Creating Test Cases, Test Suites and Test Jobs in an existing category

para.emphasis: Creating Test Cases within an already existing category:

listitem.para: To create a Test Case in an already existing category, select the category in which you want to create the Test Case with a single-click in the Test Case Browser.
Create a Test Case via the context-sensitive menu ().
You can also simply double-click on the category in which you want to create the Test Case.

para.emphasis: Creating Test Suites and Test Jobs within an already existing category:

listitem.para: To create a Test Suite or a Test Job in an already existing category, select the category in which you want to create the Test Suite or Test Job with a single-click in the Test Suite Browser.
Create a Test Suite or Test Job via the context-sensitive menu ().
To create a Test Suite, you can also simply double-click on the category in which you want to create the Test Suite.

section.title: Adding comments to categories
section.para: You can add comments to categories in the Test Suite Browser and Test Case Browser to add information on the purpose of the category:

listitem.para: In the browser, select the category you want to add a comment to, or edit a comment on.

From the context-menu, select:
Edit comment
In the dialog that appears, enter the comment for this category and press ”OK”.
You will be able to see the comment in the Properties View for this category, and as a tooltip (as long as the category has no errors or warnings).

para.para: You can also add comments to Test Cases, and Test Suites () as well as to the Project as a whole ().
